entry.title: About me
entry.summary: Zhendong Sha (CURRICULUM VITAE) received the B.Sc. degree from Nanjing University Jinling College, Nanjing, China, in 2013 and the Master degree in Computer Science from the University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, Canada, in 2018. Under the supervision of Drs. Ting Hu and Yuanzhu Chen at Queen‚Äôs University, his ongoing Ph.D. research covers developing novel feature selection methods for high-dimensional genetic data with an emphasis on gene-gene interaction and genetic heterogeneity.
entry.content:
Zhendong Sha (CURRICULUM VITAE) received the B.Sc. degree from Nanjing University Jinling College, Nanjing, China, in 2013 and the Master degree in Computer Science from the University of New Brunswick, Fredericton, Canada, in 2018. Under the supervision of Drs. Ting Hu and Yuanzhu Chen at Queen‚Äôs University, his ongoing Ph.D. research covers developing novel feature selection methods for high-dimensional genetic data with an emphasis on gene-gene interaction and genetic heterogeneity.

üîç My research

Zhendong‚Äôs primary research area is feature selection using information theory, evolutionary computation and network science. Through his long-term research goals, Zhendong aims to develop a comprehensive analytical framework that will provide clinicians with disease risk predictive models and personalized treatment plans based on a patient‚Äôs genetic background.

üè´ Education

2019~Now: Queen's University, Canada
2017~2019: Memorial University, Canada
2014~2017: Univerity of New Brunswick, Canada
2013~2014: Southeast University, China
2011~2013: Nanjing University Jinling College, China
2009~2011: Nanjing Institute of Railway Technology, China

üì¨ Contact me

Email: $firstn dot $lastn AT queensu dot ca

entry.summary:
2023

  • Sha Z, Chen Y, Hu T. NSPA: characterizing the disease association of multiple genetic interactions at single-subject resolution. Bioinformatics Advances. 2023 Feb 7

2022

  • Sha Z, Chen Y, Hu T. Genetic heterogeneity analysis using genetic algorithm and network science. InProceedings of the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference Companion 2022 Jul 9 (pp. 763-766).
entry.content:
